div.p: This is a set of rules, which represent the aspects dealt with in the HM3 rule book. Since our aim is to simplify, we will not rewrite all rules, only those that are needed. See Main Rule for the generic details.

Sometimes people ask, why rewrite the rules, if the way that they adjucate situations changes only slightly and this only adds another layer of complexity. In fact, we add a layer of simplification. The benefit of better scaling and other issues that are better addressed warrant the effort.
A convenience table for the 5-addition of zeroes. Rounding is to one fractional digit only. Multiples of 2 are left out; every doubling means a +5.

Whenever we have ML, SB or other technical terms, we append an U to distinguish the Universal rules, from the classic. E.g. MLU and SBU. You can calculate MLU as ML * 0.4. The basic 50/50 chance of success on a skill roll is with an ML of 50%, i.e. an MLU of 20. Thus the most basic task difficulty - all other things being equal - should be set to 20.
Attributes are treated as Skills with MLU twice their value. It is useful to track them accordingly.

Skill Development is applicable only to PCs and a narrative rule. Every game session, award 2 points (SP) that can each be used to increase any skill MLU in the range 0-9 by 1 point, in the range 10-19 by 1/2 points, in the range 20-29 by 1/4 points and so forth. Teachers are also handled narratively. This narrative rule can be changed or adapted at any time, it is not bound to in.world simulation.
In-world MLU improvement happens with the same range costs as above, but 1 SP is gained every month after completing NPC/PC creation.

Improving Specialties is more elaborate. Skills list specialties with a percentage value. This percentage value gives the part of the whole group that this specialization comprises. When the skill is improved (the skill group of all specialties) all improvement may be dedicated to the specialty instead.

As an example, a Skill/ASpecialty/20 could see an improvement of 5 points if ASpecialty instead of a 1 for Skill. A Skill/BSpecialty/40 could see an improvement of 2.5 points if BSpecialty instead of a 1 for Skill. Divide 100% by the given percentage to get a multiple m.
If at any time the skill itself is developed, specialties are only improved, if they would fall below the MLU of the skill otherwise. It would be prudent to learn the “opposite” Specialty.
The star-scale is often used to simplify evaluation.
Many skills can be divided into sub-skills or specialties. The specific specialty takes the initial MLU from the main skill’s MLU. Each specialty is developed as a separate skill.

Sometimes, only Specialties are given and the question arises, what MLU in the Specialty applies to the skill group. Apply the specialty rule in reverse. Take the percentage of Specialty MLU to get the skill’s MLU. For example, a Mask/20 specialty in Woodcraft of 12 would imply a Woodcraft MLU of 2.4. This applies only to MLU.
Sunsigns represent an astrological affinity to certain skills in-world, see original rules. They give a direct bonus to the MLU.

When a character attempts to use a skill, n5 is rolled, adding EMLU. The GM will have decided upon a diffculty level of the task. This value is also subtracted from the roll and if the net result is non-negative, the skill has been successfully employed; if the roll is negative, the attempt has failed. For example, if a PC declares the intent to perform a gymnastic feat, the GM would instruct the player to “test Acrobatics against difficulty 15.” In cases where success or failure may not be obvious, the GM should make the roll secretly.
To determine the degree of success or failure, use the dimensions.

When two characters use skills against each other, each character makes a p5 skill roll appropriate to the skill in question and the results are compared to give a net result. The character with the higher result wins the challenge. If both characters achieve the same success level, this is a stalemate. If a tie is not appropriate to the situation, toss a coin.

The following shows example dimensions. Finding the appropriate dimension depends on the concrete circumstances. Consider what would be appropriate for an untrained individual (MLU 0) and what is expected (the average result) for a sufficiently educated persion (MLU 20). Interprete the results inbetween and outside of the bounds accordingly.
Judging the values of goods produced or performances delivered. The value in parenthesis is the range by which the estimation may be off. Also see the Main Rule

Assume a standard task level of 20 and adjust the result for any applicable modifiers (such as Hardiness Rating, also multiplied by 0.4), the resulting net value gives double the percentage of the crop yield that is in excess or short of the 100%. (See Hârn Manor 29.) For example, if the MLU is 20, (task level is 20) all modifiers are a total of -10 and the roll itself is +5, then the net value is -5, resulting in a crop yield of 97.5% in the given year.

Climbing Speed is 1/4 walking speed at success. Speed can be modified 1/4 for a -10 penalty for a trajectory, but negative speeds are not allowed. E.g. for a +10, one can opt to simply try and cling to a holding to not fall down. A failure results in a fall, usually evenly distributed among the total climb.

One dimension is the time (in seconds), which it takes to achieve the wound level zero on the defender. The wound level is a separate dimension. You should use trajectories. Once a (rolled) progression has reached its goal, a new skill roll is necessary. It is therefore possible to play 10 second round-based combat.
The fractional parts for the higher values in the time dimension mean that multiple attacks “connect” at the same time. This is to avoid combat in split seconds.

Any effects from wounds or other external influences in combat are applied immediately to pending progressions, but the wound itself is modified by B/E/P of choice from the weapon and the appropriate armor. (These valueas are multiplied by 0.4!) The offset is along the trajectory chosen. Note that the same is true for affects on the defender. If this implies an action to occur in the past, it is resolved immediately.
For missiles and thrown weapons do not modify the time dimension below 5s. Reloading a crossbow takes 10s.
For grappling, wounds are treated as penalty to activity that involves the affected body part instead of damage to heal. Such wounds are reduced to zero, once the grapple is no longer maintained.
The time dimension is the time it takes to pick up a dropped item.
The resolution is in mm/m or m/km. Typical modifications are made for contrast (positive), movement (positive), distraction (negative), on the border of the visual field (negative).

Healing time is given for one point. Subtract the number of points twice from the roll. Note that a reduction in the effective wound points causes re-evaulation of the effective healing rate, but should be ignored for playability.

Stamina is used for Injury points to heal wounds individually and the time unit is days. Add a potential physician’s bonus (see below) once when determining the healing rate.Healing rate can be improved with a physician present during the healing process in the same manner.
Endurance is used for Fatigue points in total and the unite is minutes.
Injury healing rate improvement for physicians is the second dimension. The dimension value is added to the Stamina roll.
At 0, we have understanding normal speech, -10 is subdued speech, -20 a whisper, 10 is the noise vehicles make, 20 are battle noises and 30 is thunder.

Initiative reflects battle experience, discipline, and morale. Initiative determines the speed in which characters can assess a stressful situation. Characters take the time listed before they can act. An ambush and similar situations can give a bonus.

During the time a character is “frozen” this way, he is trying to understand the situation he is in and assesses the options he has. He is cautious during that time. General awareness issues such as during an ambush are not covered by Initiative.

Battle-hardened characters may come into the fractional range often. Optionally fractions can be used to determine who goes first. The GM determines, whether going first impedes the action of another already in the second that action culminates. This changes the drama of simultaneous activity, which may or may not be appropriate.
Jumping is tested when a character attempts to leap for height or distance. Results assume a running start; for standing jumps, halve heights and distances. Results below 0 turn into a Fall.
This dimension can also be used as knowledge about knowledge, i.e. how sure is the character that his reproduction of the knowledge is correct.
0: Character barely knows the domain for such knowledge exists. With some luck, he can guess whether a general topic belongs to that domain or not.
10: The basic concepts are known, the more esoteric concepts have been heard of but cannot be applied.
20: Almost all concepts of the domain are known and can be applied with confidence. Only a few topics escape the grasp.
30: All of the domain is understood with ease. It is hard to find unknown territory, although it exists. Improvement of the art is possible.
40: Mastery of the subject matter as far as humanly possible. Genuine research or creation of new substance is possible.
A fatigue rate of 1 fatigue per minute is multiplied be the result in the table. Mental Conflict is resolved similar to normal combat.

This table is used for running, Fatigue is at 1 per second. Reducing speed by a factor, reduces the recovery rate by the same factor. Roll once for the course. Accumulate Fatigue in the end, unless abused.

Piety is not learned as usual but measured by behavior. It can be imrpoved for each deity separately, but common sense applies for conflicting deities. For playability, treat Piety as a separate class of skills when learning.
0: Character knows that the religion exists but cannot separate it from other convocations.
10: Lip service payed to the religion and ability to separate it from other major faiths.
20: The main tenets are known and followed individually. Sects/heresies are not a topic.
30: Religion is quoted often and other faiths routinely treated unfairly.
40: Adherent is seeking to further the religion outside of his immediate domain. Distinction between inner-religion minutiae are important.
50: Heresy is abhorred. Support for the religion takes precedent over other interests.
60: Adherent is a prophet and accepts serious consequences for following details of his faith. May invent rituals and the like.

For NPCs the associated table can be used to estimate the number of different recipes they know how to create. PCs should rather keep a book and start with what their master has given them. Self-made dabblers start with zero (0) and would need to do research. Recipes have a wide range of meaning, from classic cooking to tricks the character can teach to animals. It includes ritual or magic invocations.

Multiple orators may compete for the “airwaves” and hinder each other more than they realize. Therefore only two actors may combine their skills through 5-Addition if working in concert, thereafter it is only the maximum, if no competition takes place. If a competition takes place, the difficulty is a 5-Addition instead.

The listed weight (excluding your own body) can be lifted as maximum. Fatigue is 10/minute. Reducing weight by a factor, reduces the fatigue rate by the same factor. Roll once for the activity. Accumulate Fatigue, unless abused. Weight carried in kg is a penalty to the move roll.

Difficulty of swimming conditions is 10 times the Hârnic wind number. With a result below 0 the character starts to sink at the given speed. Fatigue is 1/minute. Reducing speed by a factor, reduces the fatigue rate by the same factor. A resting swimmer rolls to see if they sink, but does not move (except with the current). Underwater Swimming is at half speed. This includes drowning. When attempting to convey a (non-)swimmer, apply a penalty of 5.
The distance thrown in meters is the n5 roll doubled. E.g. a character with MLU of 15 and a roll of +4 throws a suitable object for a distance of 38 meters.
Time into the future. Also use the Accuracy dimension for trajectories.

The Fast Yield is used for Fishing, Foraging, and Hunting with a dimension unit a 1 man-day of food. The Slow Yield when failure can be compensated by spending more time is used for Fletching, where the unit us 1/4 bow or 4 arrows. For trajectories, a dimension cannot be set to zero. Note that most activity cannot be extended beyond 8 hours per day.
As example 4h with MLU 5 fast yields 1. For Slow Yield, the same MLU needs 9h to get 1. spent, adjust accordingly.

At the beginning of each combat the players and GM should jointly decide which action options they want to allow and which will simply be abstracted by a set penalty/bonus by the GM. This can speed up combat tremendously. If tactical options outside of combat are affected by the decision, the GM should inform the players of that. For instance, if mounted combat is to tedious today, than the PCs might just as well dismount already to allow for smoother combat resolution.

In order to simulate larger combats with many participants, the usual 5-Addition can be used. It does not provide as many tactical options as individual combat does, but greatly reduces time spent. Both time and wound dimension should be scaled linearly with the number of particpipants. E.g. a wound of 5 after 30 seconds would scale to a total of 50 points after 5 minutes for 10 people or to 500 points after 50 minutes for 100 people. The points should be distributed in reasonable batches on the participants on each side, the smallest batch size being the wounds rolled. People can be hit multiple times, but points beyond 40 generally don’t make sense unless explosives, catapults, or similar are involved.
Use 40% of any double-digit ML modifiers as MLU modifier. An asterisk (*) indicates that Stumble or Fumbles may apply.

Fatigue recovers 1/10 seconds. With spirit dissolution, fatigue turns into injury. Note that spirits can take arbitrary injury before being destroyed and may heal forever. Only in rare cases (e.g. divine intervention) can spirits be destroyed.
Subtract 2 from Missile MLU for being mounted. To avoid lengthy calculations, subtract 50% of the attacker speed in m/s.

Every character has an Engagement Zone of 1m plus weapon length radius about his center (that does not extend into blocked areas). The Engagement Zone of a conscious, prone character is only half that. Unconscious characters have no Engagement Zones but may constitute obstacles. A character may be (melee) attacked upon entering an enemy’s Engagement Zone until he leaves that zone. This entering or leaving may be active or passive. It is possible to be engaged with an arbitrary number of enemies at a time. A character with a long reach weapon has an appropriately larger engagement zone and may therefore be eligible to attack before others. This may be of importance for mounted Charges into a row of Pikemen. Also note the restriction on using long weapons at short range. dimensions.

Every engagement along the way may attack a moving character (and vice versa). Any attacker plunging into defenders with an attack will stop. Such a forced stop will result in a fall impact for charger as if from height equal to the speed minus 5. E.g. stopping at 10 m/s speed equals a fall from 5m. Note that the fall impact also applies the targets fallen into. This is the charge bonus which can be added to the attack. For opportunistic melee attacks, this is also a direct penalty to the Dodge skill.

The push attempt must be in the direction the attacker is facing and the attacker must follow. The defender has a choice to evade into a semi-circle of up to 120 degrees, assuming no obstacles. Instead of Injury points, meters (pushed) are used. The defender is forced to deduct the move from his action allowance, regardless of whether he resists or not. A resist deducts from the distance forced and can even be used as a counter-push. The pushed character may opt to fall prone instead at any time, for instance to avoid falling of a cliff. Any remaing distance is forfeit.
Use Acrobatics skill.
Use Dexterity skill.

A rider and horse may act in unison and add their combat skill per 5-Addition. Both accrue the same fatigue. Hitting the wrong target can happen in melee combat. Anybody within an engagement zone is subject to an (unintentional) attack with MLU 0. This can be added to the benefit of other attackers as per multiple attacks above or resolved individually with the goal of 0 damage. A character who is attacking (or being attacked by) a prone enemy increases Attack/Defense MLU with that character by 4.

For throwing arbitrary objects, use Throwing skill. Since missile attacks are resolved with individual shots, a missed attack is applied only if the intended attack had no impact. Count all potential targets completely in an arc of 30 degrees and +/-2 range levels of the intended target. Use 5-Addition of zeroes, but reduce by 5 for the missed, intended opponent. If a hit is scored on the much larger “super-target”, roll which individual target is hit by distributing evenly among all the unintended targets. When determining hit chances and damage apply the size modifier from the Size table below. At GM discretion, inanimate objects not participating in the skirmish may be counted as potential targets, particularly, if the actual targets are spread widely across the area. This increase can be used purposefully and can be quite devastating when firing at advancing troops. Dodge against missile is reduced by 5.
Use Unarmed Combat skill when no weapon is involved. Multiple Grapples are allowed , but keep track of the grappled weapons of all opponents, they can no longer be used to full potential.

For dodging, use Dodge skill. Dodge and Block/Parry are added through 5-Addition, if used together. Dodge/parry is mostly used at the same time an attack is contemplated by the defender himself. Every defense causes a -5 penalty to all activity, which phases out within 10 seconds. E.g., the first attacker is defended at full MLU, the second at MLU-5 and the third is at MLU-10 and so on. Note that multiple attacks can be 5-added instead. In that case a second attack gets a bonus of 5, etc. Also note that Dodge is at -5 for high velocity missile attacks.

The Attacker may declare one Main area as not being hit for a penalty of 1 to MLU. This choice can be taken multiple times, but the remaining Main locations must remain (bodily) connected. If all but one Main location has been eliminated, individual percentage points may be reduced for a Detail area. This penalty can again be taken multiple times but the remaining Detail hit locations must be (bodily) connected. The GM may restrict or penalize the choice of Aiming Zone if the attacker could only reach certain target zones with the declared attack weapon. A prone attacker would find it difficult to aim high on a standing opponent with a melee weapon. The Size table can be used, if the target is smaller than man-sized. This effect does not cumulate with aiming for parts of a target (the main part of this paragraph). There is no modification for man-sized creatures, unless the target offers a smaller effective target, but it may be combined with unintentional hitting (see above). A prone man, for example, presents a target about 2 feet tall, and a crouching man about 4 feet tall. Similar height adjustments may apply to other targets at GM discretion.

Any new wound of at least 1 point to arms results in a Fumble chance. Use accumulated damage to that extremity and fatigue as difficulty for a Dexterity skill roll against 0. Failure results in dropping anything held on that arm. If something is held in both hands, 5-add the difficulties and the two Dexterity EMLUs.

Any new wound of at least 1 point to legs results in a stumble chance. Use accumulated damage to that extremity and fatigue as difficulty for an Agility skill roll against 0. Failure results in dropping prone. Each additional leg after the first can be 5-added.

Any new wound of at least 1 point results in a Shock chance. Use accumulated injury and fatigue as difficulty for a Stamina skill roll against 0. Failure results in unconsciousness for a time indiciated in the Shock table.
Instead of (autonomous) Healing, Repair must be applied externally. Use the appropriate Craft skill instead of Physician.

Weapon and Armor make a Shock roll for the damage that they absorb, respectively deal. Weapon Quality (WQ) is used instead of Stamina skill and damage is not accumulated. Armor works the same way, but instead if Stamina, sum up BEPF. Failure means a weapon or armor breaks, which may potentially be repaired as above. (Regular maintenance is assumed, otherwise accumlate 1 point per “unrepaired wound” for weapons and armor for the purpose of Shock rolls.

Damage taken increases with every complete multiple of 5 injury level above 6 every 10s. For example, a 16-20 point injury causes 2 points per 10 seconds, or 1 point of bloodloss every 5 seconds. Some wounds will not cause bloodloss (e.g. Frost) including to inanimate objects or reduced damage, e.g. blunt trauma.

Fall Table
Shock Table

Combatants who sustain Serious or Grievous wounds may die during the healing routine. On the other hand, various types of magic, miracles, Psionics, and potions can improve healing.

When the following text says, adjacent body parts are affected, effects include penalties (which are not cumulative but take the maximum) infection chance and bloodloss (also not cumulative but take the maximum). They are not recursive, i.e. do not imply secondary effects.
1-5: Minor. Wounds only have wound penalty.

5-10: Serious. Wounds of this type also have minor effects on neighbouring detailed body parts at 5 points less. Any activity involving these body parts are at the appropriate penalty. These effect wounds do not heal separately.

11-15: Grievous. The detailed body part cannot be used, serious use effects on neighbouring detailed body parts, and minor on neighboring main parts. (This might only be the including main part.) These effect wounds do not heal separately. Minor effects are at 10 less than the Grievous, while serious are 5 less.

16-20: Incapacitating, the main body part cannot be used, serious use effects on neighbouring main body parts. (For head this means unconsciousness and for thorax imminent death.) Serious effects are at 10 less than the incapacitating wound itself.

21+: Destroyed, the main body part lost its integrity, Grievous use effects on neighbouring main body parts. (For limbs this means at least severed. Thorax is split open or spinal cord severed. For all but the extremities this means instant death. For all other body parts, death is probably imminent due to the side effects.) Grievous use effects are at 10 less than the Destroyed wound itself.

See the Healing dimension. An untreated wound is considered as being treated by a Physician with the negative wound-level. E.g. a wound with 6 injury points is treated as if diagnosed by Physician with MLU -6. The standard treatments mostly known by all still need to be applied and detailed, so a physician’s diagnosis is always necessary. “Destroyed” wounds may be treated as incapacitating, with a Bonus on Diagnosis of 5. Note that the usage effects on bordering regions needs to be treated as well. Overtreatment is possible but has no specific negative impact.

Bloodloss is treated as a separate injury. Note that the circulatory system is incapacitated with points in excess of 15 points as other body parts are. The circulatory system itself will not turn infectious. Treatment by physicians depend on the location. Some locations are incurable by Hârnic physicians. For multiple bleeders only take the maximum in the same extremity, but add those for different extremities. Incapacitating and destroying wounds have no additional effects over the bleeder and infection dangers.
Infections, diseases, toxins, and other come in various forms. Bloodloss is already explained elsewhere, but repeated here for reference.

Bloodloss Once a wound in excess of 10 points is received, bloodloss is calculated. (Some form of damage do not create bloodloss, e.g. diseases.) This number is lost every 10 seconds until the treatment Compress is applied. Thereafter these points heal at 1 per day.

Infection An open wound with more than 5 injury points is attacked daily with MLU of the injury points against Stamina (skill) until it has less than 5 points or is otherwise closed. The injury points start with 1 and are received 1 per watch until the infection has run its course, i.e. the result rolled. The healing rate is modified by all running infections’ points and the injury points of the wound in question.

Sleep deprivation Every watch after a Stamina roll against -20 in hours, with a penalty of 1 per hour of not having slept. For playability start rolling after 24h and the injury points are always 5. The points are regained at the rate of 1 per hour of sleep.

Thirst Every watch after a Stamina roll against -20, with a penalty of 1 for each liter of water that has not been drunk per day on average. For playability start rolling after 3 days without water have passed. Points are regained at the rate of 1 per hour.

Hunger Every day after a Stamina roll against -20, with a penalty of 1 for each two pounds of food that have not been eaten per day on average. For playability start rolling after 10 days without food have passed. Points are regained at the rate of 1 per hour.

Suffocation Every minute without air a Stamina roll against 0 is required, with a penalty of 5 for each consecutive minute without air. Points are regained at the rate of 1 per second once air is available again..
In the course of Harn campaigns specific rules become necessary such that our simplifications do not defeat their purpose. We collect them as they come up.
PEF equals 0.0 at MLU 0, 1.0 at MLU of 20 and 2.0 at MLU 40. All Indices, including Working conditions are treated on a star-scale, i.e. as a skill. The text is what can be observed.
Working Conditions have a PEF factor of 1 for 300h/month, with a relative change of 0.1 for every 120h change.
FDI is 1d = 1 index point until 30, any additional effective expenditure is treated as a secondary and separate LXI, which is compounded into FDI.
CLI and HKI use a 1d = 1 index point instead of the table. After 20d, only half an index point is granted.
LXI is calculated in range brackets as follows: 0-1:0, 1-3:1, 4-6:2, 7-10:3, and so forth. (55-66:10, 210-231:20.)
LSI is calculated as sqm per resident. (3ft = 1m.)

Overall SLI is the average of FDI, CLI, HKI, LXI, and LSI. Since the complexity of mal-nutrition, sanitatry conditions, weather and other circumstances cannot be simulated within reasonably playability, GM discretion is advised.

After a short chant of 10 seconds, caster makes an active p5 roll adding RSUI, which anyone hearing must roll WILU + p5 or flee until he is no longer aware of the caster’s location and he has broken morale.

Effective distance is adding invoker’s and target’s eyesight (skill) in dm (1/10 m). Roll n5 Charm skill vs Will skill. The result is a direct penalty the target receives on any active action (not awareness, healing, passive triggering, etc). This penalty is reduced at 1 per second, but multiple attempts are allowed. Negative results are treated as severity for psionic episodes, severity as if the invoker was himself affected, including fade-out..

Roll n5 Skill. Dimension is Fast Yield (Time) for a Distance of 10 meters. The vision includes random senses, usually sight and are always informative, but never complete. They come within seconds at the appropriate time, if 0 is reached. Otherwise not at all.
Duration is Skill + n5 roll in minutes. Return is always a Mental conflict, the “vacant” opponent is ML 0. Preparation is Will attribute minutes - this is not a dimension.

The duration is 20 seconds at 0, halved or doubled for every 20 levels difference. [2] reduces n5 fatigue points at 20, if positive. [3] reduces bloodloss at 20 with slow yield. [4] improve healing as physician skill, may be 5-added.

The duration trajectory of an initiating trance is 20 minutes at 0 and halved/doubled every 10 points. The range for communication is governed by the Knowledge dimension, specific Ethereals are specific concepts, a known name grants a +10 bonus. Control is the third trajectory, which also uses the knowledge dimension. Any task must be within the ability of the ethereal or it will fail, also depending on the ability of the ethereal to subvert the intent. Ignoring a mental conflict is not within the ability of any ethereal. Passive triggering involves a 5 minute daydreaming trance (assumed to happen automatically) with 0 control and 0 communication. An ethereal may attempt to intiate communication on its end, i.e. 5-add its skill.
Detection range and duration are adjusted (as is strength) according to target. Passive triggering works like Attunement at -20.

The talent has three dimensions: Range, Duration, and Language. The range is determined to reach the target and the other dimensions (trajectory) may be chosen by the user. The range is MLU in kilometers, and the duration is 30 seconds, halved or doubled for every 20 levels difference. Language is the effectiveness a concept can be shared. It is capped by a combined skill roll in a common language, if the recipient is willing. Otherwise it is capped by individual skill rolls.
A list of specialties: Skill/Specialty/Percentage.
Sword/Shortsword/40.

Encounter severity is rolled with a p5. The result is treated as a potential wound average. I.e. this is the effect it will have on the life if left “untreated”. The roll result is divided by 2 to get the wound level.

p.em: (This allows PCs (and the GM) to ignore minor events for playability but have an effect at the same time. Such a potential wound average can be imagined to have been caused by encountering a disease, an accident, such as a sprained ankle while walking, equipment break down, an attack by animals, or a bar room scuffle, and so on. The GM shall use something appropriate for the environment. The existing tables can be used for inspiration, but remember that the severity of the average outcome has been determined first.)

div.p: Individual effects can be broken down by treating them by a reverse 5-addition, e.g. two people getting a 10 means both having a wound of 5.
Steady Wind (2) is optimal, for (1) and (3) half the speed and for (0) and (4) halve it again. Effects on hazards are not covered yet. The table below gives leagues per watch or km/h.
Maritime Travel Table

Oar movement is full at calm (0) wind, reduced by 25% for light (1) and 50% for steady (2) wind. No rowing is possible in stronger wind conditions. Rowing and Sailing may not be combined during a watch.
Maritime Oar Travel Table

Overland travel is basically 30km a day or 3.5 days per 100km. The following table applies only to overland travel only in time and distance dimensions. The modifiers apply only to overland travel in distance and time domains. Modifiers are cumulative. The standard distance/time assumes a crop- or woodland, clear weather, on foot, and not on a road. Modifiers are applied individually, e.g. speed is multiplied by 0.8 for a modifier of -20. Order is irrelevant.
10: Hills (-), Trail (+)
15: Cart (-), Rain (-)
20: Heath (-)
25: Wagon (-)
30: Mixed Woods (-), Unpaved Road (+)
35: Muddy (-)
40: Mountains (-), Needleleaf Forest (-)
50: Paved Road (+), Mud (-)
80: Swamp (-), Storm (-)
100: Horse (+)

Speeding up land travel is a matter of dealing with long-term Fatigue. Rate is 1/watch but healed as a non-spreading, non-infectious Leg Injury Endurance-based. Increase and reduce speed and fatigue rate proportionally.

The power level of artifacts is always twice the depletion roll target. Charge depletion is a p5 roll after use and always obvious to those attuned but not anyone else. Individual powers are determined at 10 point intervals each in a predetermined order. Later rolls will use the same order, at 0 the depletion target is discovered.
Roll WILU + n5 against 10. Depletion target is 10+.
A roll of WILU + n5 against 30 gives distance a target is able to approach. Depletion target is 20+.
Use n5 plus Aura skill with direct addition of Sensitivity (Psionics) vs. power of the artifact and use Slow Yield dimension.
